There's a lot of good thinking in Erik's work. He can keep an expression equal and still break apart or group the factors.

Let's find where Erik changed the value of the expression.

###Step 1

$\begin{align}
2\times \redE{7{,}000} &=2\times \redE{7 \times 1{,}000}\\\\
&\neq 2\times \redE{7 \times 100}
\end{align}$

Erik did *not* break apart the factors of ${7
{,}000}$ correctly.
Erik made a mistake in step $1$.
